title: Authorizes a general hospital to identify and use immediate measures to move admitted patients from emergency departments within four hours of being admitted
summary: Authorizes a general hospital to identify and use immediate measures to move admitted patients from emergency departments within four hours of being admitted; provides that every general hospital shall develop planning to prevent the diversion of patients to other hospitals and the maintenance of admitted patients within emergency departments for more than four hours; stipulates that such patients should be moved to alternative appropriate locations in the hospital; directs general hospitals to plan to prevent diversion of patients to other general hospitals; directs the commissioner of health to perform periodic inspections to ensure compliance; provides for reporting and investigation of violations. admitted patients moved to

       AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to hospital crowding

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Section  2805-b  of  the  public health law is amended by
    2  adding a new subdivision 6 to read as follows:
    3    6. (A) A GENERAL HOSPITAL SHALL IDENTIFY AND USE IMMEDIATE MEASURES TO
    4  MOVE ANY ADMITTED PATIENT IN THE EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT  TO  AN  ALTERNATE
    5  APPROPRIATE LOCATION WITHIN FOUR HOURS OF BEING ADMITTED. IN IDENTIFYING
    6  SUCH  ALTERNATIVE  LOCATIONS THE GENERAL HOSPITAL SHALL CONSIDER THE USE
    7  OF BEDS IN SOLARIUMS AND HALLWAYS NEAR NURSING STATIONS AS WELL AS OTHER
    8  APPROPRIATE  LOCATIONS.  ALL  STAFFING,  SERVICES,  PRIVACY,   INFECTION
    9  CONTROL AND CONFIDENTIALITY PROCEDURES SHALL BE CONSISTENTLY IN PLACE IN
   10  ALL GENERAL HOSPITALS REGARDLESS OF BED LOCATION.
   11    (B)  EVERY  GENERAL  HOSPITAL SHALL HAVE IN PLACE EFFECTIVE MONITORING
   12  PROTOCOLS TO TRACK AND IDENTIFY LENGTH OF STAY PATTERNS AND  DEVIATIONS,
   13  BOTH FOR INPATIENTS AND FOR PATIENTS IN THE EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT.
   14    (C)  EVERY  GENERAL  HOSPITAL  SHALL  DEVELOP  APPROPRIATE PLANNING TO
   15  PREVENT THE DIVERSION OF PATIENTS TO OTHER  GENERAL  HOSPITALS  AND  THE
   16  MAINTENANCE  OF  ADMITTED PATIENTS WITHIN EMERGENCY DEPARTMENTS FOR MORE
   17  THAN FOUR HOURS.
   18    (D) THE COMMISSIONER SHALL CONDUCT  PERIODIC  INSPECTIONS  OF  GENERAL
   19  HOSPITAL EMERGENCY DEPARTMENTS TO:
